{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, it is mentioned that oral malodor can be controlled by oral hygiene measures such as tooth brushing, dental prophylaxis, tongue scraping and rinsing with antiseptic mouth washes. Furthermore, experimental evidence suggests that putrefaction of sulphur-containing proteinaceous substrates by predominantly gram-negative oral microorganisms is the primary cause of oral malodor. Therefore, it can be inferred that a condition that increases the caries activity in the oral cavity would also increase the production of oral malodor.", "answer_choice": "A"}
